title: Felix Arscott
summary: Felix Medland Arscott (12 November 1922 â€“ 5 July 1996) was a British mathematician who was a member of the Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics from 1976.[1] He was described by colleagues as a good friend and excellent teacher.[2] Dr. Arscott was the founding head of the Applied Mathematics department at University of Manitoba from 1974 through 1986[3] and was named Professor Emeritus in 1995.[4] Professor Arscott was described as an expert in the "higher special functions".
